documents.title: met office issues warning for ice and snow
text: the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for ice and snow for some parts of the east midlands .
the warning is in place from 04:00 tomorrow through to 11:00 on wednesday .
a mixture of rain , sleet , snow and hail is likely to cause icy conditions and tricky driving conditions .
this evening will turn cold and increasingly windy with a mixture of clear spells and heavy showers , which could be wintry over higher ground .
expect icy patches with lows of 0c ( 32f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: primary schools to expand because of 'demand for places '
text: three primary schools in nottingham will expand to create 480 new places because there is a shortage , nottingham city council said .
the local authority said there was a `` demand for school places '' because nottingham is growing economically and homes are being built .
glade hill primary school in bestwood has been given a £ 1.8m investment by nottingham city council to create 210 new places .
a total of 26 nursery places will also be created by september 2019 .
middleton primary school in wollaton will also have 210 new places by december 2019 following investment of £ 4.1m .
westbury special school in bilborough will have £ 4.75m investment and will create 60 primary and secondary places .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: photo released of missing derby teenager
text: police have released an updated photo of missing teenager sophie waldram .
the 17-year-old was last seen in london road , derby on 9 january .
officers had previously released a photo of sophie with pink hair but it is actually blonde .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: councillor aims to read to 2,018 children in one month
text: the man in charge of education for under fives in nottingham has set himself a challenge to read to at least 2,018 children by the end of january .
councillor david mellen is asking people to sponsor him to visit schools , children 's centres , libraries , hospitals and nurseries across all 20 wards in the city .
mr mellen wants to encourage more young people to read and recently visited blue bell hill in st ann 's on his quest .
he is hoping to raise £ 2,018 though sponsorship which will go towards the dolly parton imagination library which delivers a free book every month to children up to the age of five .
mr mellen said : `` we would like to get books into loads of homes in nottingham , books are quite expensive and loads of people are on low incomes , so books might not be a priority . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: midfielder joe ledley 'fit for next match '
text: derby boss gary rowett remains hopeful midfielder joe ledley will be fit for friday 's clash with bristol city at pride park .
the welsh international has n't played since coming off late in the boxing day game against hull city .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: new device could help farmers detect if sheep are lame
text: new technology has been developed in nottingham which could help farmers automatically detect if their sheep are lame .
lameness , which can cause huge welfare and economical problems in flock , costs the farming sector an estimated £ 80m a year .
the tracking device being trialled by the university of nottingham aims to reduce that .
leicestershire farmer charles sercombe , who is the chairman of the national farmer 's union 's national livestock , said : `` what i would like to see is trials and results .
`` i would like to possibly try it on my own farm and compare it to what we do on an everyday basis .
`` if it can be used as a really early warning device to give us an earlier notice than we would detect , then i think it would be really beneficial . ''
author: Giles Taylor
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: two arrested after 'man injured by knife '
text: two people have been arrested following a fight between two groups of people in hyson green .
nottinghamshire police said the fight started just before 15:00 when a group of men attacked another group in gregory boulevard .
a man is believed to have been injured by a knife in the fight , the force added .
his injuries are not believed to be life-threatening .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: shop worker chases away armed robber
text: a robber armed with a suspected gun was chased out of a shop by a member of staff .
the man pointed the weapon and demanded cash at the beeston mini market in chilwell road , nottinghamshire police said .
but a female worker chased him out of the shop and the man ran towards imperial road .

judy sleath , who was just a couple of doors down when it happened , said : `` armed police arrived with machine guns and it was all a bit frightening you do n't expect this sort of thing on chilwell road . ''
it happened at about 11:00 today .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: snow on its way for east midlands
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for snow and ice in the east midlands from 04:00 tomorrow to 11:00 on wednesday .
it says sleet , snow and hail will hit the north of england tonight and then move down through the midlands with 2-6cm accumulations possible on higher ground .
the warning covers derby , derbyshire and nottinghamshire but not nottingham , leicester , leicestershire or rutland .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: historian relieved station fire damage was n't worse
text: a local historian says he 's glad the heritage aspects of nottingham railway station appear to have avoided being damaged by the fire on friday .
however dr john beckett , part of history group the thoroton society , said he 's concerned at how such a major fire was able to erupt in a building that had only recently been refurbished .
he said : `` what about the sprinklers and all those kind of things that we expect in modern constructs ? ''
an investigation into the cause of the fire is still ongoing .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: findern fly-tipper ordered to pay £ 2,500
text: the man responsible for dumping this waste in findern last may has been ordered by a court to pay more than £ 2,500 .
the 32-year-old was tracked down by south derbyshire district council after surveillance cameras caught him dropping a mixture of household and building waste on land near staker lane .
he was fined £ 1,000 , ordered to pay a £ 100 victim surcharge and handed a bill for £ 1,457 in legal costs , along with a six-month driving ban .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: woman robbed at knifepoint in derby city centre
text: a 20-year-old woman had her handbag stolen after being threatened with a knife in derby city centre .
police said a man in a dark tracksuit demanded the bag after confronting her in nuns street on thursday night .
the man was white and believed to be in his late 20s or early 30s .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: leicester cord blood rules leave couple frustrated
text: a couple expecting their first baby have criticised the trust that runs hospitals in leicester for not allowing them to collect and store blood from their baby 's umbilical cord
like a growing number of new parents , andy and collette spooner want to pay a private firm to bank the blood in the hope stem cells from it could cure future illnesses in their family .
but the companies are n't allowed to operate in leicester - even though they can at hospitals in nottingham and derby .
university hospitals of leicester trust runs a scheme where all collected cord blood is donated to the nhs and leukaemia charity anthony nolan .
the trust said : `` we believe the best clinical approach to using cord stem cells is to pool samples and for the pooled stem cells to be available to those that need them . ''
mr and mrs spooner have appealed without success and say they 're `` frustrated '' at the lack of choice .
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

thankfully nobody inside the car or property was hurt .

derbyshire police said sophie waldram was last seen on 9 january in london road .
sophie was last seen wearing a black padded jacket and she was carrying a black rucksack .

documents.title: street lights to be replaced with leds in mansfield
text: more than 13,000 street lights in mansfield will be replaced with new energy efficient leds from april .
it is part of nottinghamshire county council 's aim to replace half of their 94,000 lantern-type lights .
so far 37,000 have already been converted , which according to the authority will save £ 1.5m in energy bills each year .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man , 81 , assaulted after confronting burglar
text: an elderly man was assaulted in his own home when he confronted a burglar in his kitchen .
the 81-year-old was pushed over and cash was stolen from his wallet , leicestershire police said .
it happened in montrose road south in eyres monsell at about 15:30 on 29 december .
the male offender was described as white , about 30 years old and approximately 5ft 7ins tall .
he was wearing a dark grey woollen hat , a black jacket , jeans and boots .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: grey most popular colour for new cars in east mids
text: grey was the most popular colour for people buying new cars in the east midlands last year , figures have shown .
this went against the national trend , which saw black as the most popular colour choice , with grey second .
the figures , released by the society of motor manufacturers and traders , showed almost 60 % of new cars sold in the uk were either black , grey or white .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: fire service appeals for more volunteers
text: a shortage of on-call volunteer firefighters is putting a strain on the fire service in leicestershire and rutland , bosses have said .
uppingham is one of the worst affected stations - it currently only has nine on-call firefighters when it should have 19 .
vince howard , who helps to organise the scheme for the fire service , has said he hopes a number of 'give-it-a-go days ' across the area will encourage more people to get involved .
he said : `` they make a huge difference to the community - not only as an individual but in promoting team spirit . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man and woman 'sprayed with noxious substance '
text: a man and a woman were taken to hospital after a report that they were sprayed with a noxious substance following an altercation in nuthall .
nottinghamshire police were called to perivale close at 20:37 on saturday .
the man and woman 's injuries are not believed to be serious or life-altering .
police say their investigation is ongoing but added their enquiries have established it was not an acid attack .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: council 's energy company makes £ 7.5m loss
text: an energy company set up by nottingham city council has lost more than £ 7.5m in its first full year of trading , according to the annual accounts .
robin hood energy was set up to reduce energy bills for some of the poorest people in nottingham .
it is understood council taxpayers ' money has been ploughed into the company to make up the shortfall .

councillor steve battlemuch , who is the chairman of the robin hood energy board , said : `` this is what happens when you set up an energy company and any energy company of our similar size is in this situation .
`` in fact , we are on course to break even far ahead of our competitors . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man charged after nottingham knifepoint robbery
text: a man has been charged in connection with a knifepoint robbery in nottingham .
police were called to talbot street at 01:50 gmt on friday after a report of a mobile phone being stolen .
two men were arrested , one in waverley street where a taser was used .
the road was then closed for several hours .
a man is due to appear at nottingham magistrates ' court charged with robbery and assault with intent to resist arrest .
he has also been charged with obstructing a police officer in the execution of their duty and failing to appear at court .
an 18-year-old man arrested on sus of robbery has been released under investigation .
nottinghamshire police referred itself to the independent office for police conduct following the arrest as a man was injured after being tasered .
an officer was also hurt and was treated for a hand injury .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: lost walker sparks massive peak district rescue operation
text: four rescue teams were involved in an operation to find a walker who went missing in the peak district yesterday .
kinder mountain rescue team had received a panicked call from the man 's family and enlisted the help of glossop , edale and buxton rescue teams for the search .
after almost four hours of looking , the lost walker was eventually located in the black ashop moor area of kinder and led back to safety .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: attempted murder charge after car hits pedestrian
text: a man has been charged with attempted murder after a pedestrian was hit by a car in normanton .

police said a 19-year-old man suffered serious but non life-threatening injuries when he was hit by a vauxhall insignia near the junction of grange avenue and village street at about 22:40 on friday .
the 25-year-old man , from spondon , is due to appear before magistrates today .
a 16-year-old girl and a 25-year-old woman , who were arrested over the weekend in connection with the crash , have been released while investigations continue .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: church-owned hotel to open in october
text: church bosses are planning to convert to a disused building near leicester cathedral into a hotel .
the diocese of leicester has bought the grade ii-listed st martin 's lodge in peacock lane and is planning a `` sympathetic '' restoration to turn it into a 28-room bed and breakfast hotel .
it 's scheduled to open in october but visitors can start booking rooms from april .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: new homes to be built at former theme park site
text: the company behind plans to redevelop the old american adventure site near ilkeston has confirmed work will begin in the coming months .
waystone construction will build around 300 new homes , a garden centre , a retirement village and leisure facilities on the former theme park grounds .
the attraction closed in january 2007 and the site has stood derelict ever since .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: murder arrest after man dies in loughborough
text: a 22-year old man has been arrested on sus of murder following the death of a man in loughborough .

the man died at the scene while being treated by paramedics .
officers will be in the area throughout today to reassure the local community .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: collapsing carillion lost east midlands contracts
text: construction giant carillion is to go into liquidation , threatening thousands of jobs .
the move came after talks between the firm , its lenders and the government failed to reach a deal to save the uk 's second biggest construction company .

the firm has been involved in a number of projects and services in the east midlands , including taking charge of cleaning at nottingham 's two main hospitals until the contract was ended last year following concerns about its performance .
in derbyshire , the firm has been involved in the building of several schools including alfreton grange .
it also used to be in charge of mending derby 's roads until the contract was taken back in-house by the city council .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: ticket office closed after nottingham railway station fire
text: train services in nottingham are running as normal for commuters this morning following friday 's fire .
however , parts of the station , including the ticket office , are still closed after suffering major damage in the blaze .
radio nottingham 's hayley compton said smoke could still be smelt throughout the building , which is also without water .
the fire , which started in the ladies ' toilets on friday morning , is being treated as arson and police are studying cctv footage as part of the investigation .
you can smell the smoke and see the soot but apart from that it 's business as usual at nottingham station .
police are treating the fire on friday as arson which was so ferocious it melted some of the pipes which means there 's no water to the entire station .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
